description: The first part of three of The Divine Comedy, an epic poem written by Dante Alighieri between 1308 and his death in 1321. The poem is written in the first person, and tells of Dante's journey through the three realms of the dead, lasting from the night before Good Friday to the Wednesday after Easter in the spring of 1300. Allegorically, the Vision of Hell or Inferno represents the Christian soul seeing sin for what it really is, and the three beasts represent three types of sin: the self-indulgent, the violent, and the malicious. To have access to this classic masterpiece download our ebook today!
